entry.title: Yevhen Klopotenko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Yevhen Klopotenko (pictured) fought a "war for borscht"?

entry.title: a man who used a false identity (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a street in San Francisco was named after a man who used a false identity?

entry.title: Radiosoul (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Alfie Templeman described the style of his studio album Radiosoul as "incohesively cohesive"?

entry.title: Rosemary Miller (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rosemary Miller won her state's skeet shooting championship one year after learning the sport, and then won a state shooting championship in all but two years for the rest of her life?

entry.title: Nexz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Japanese boy band Nexz was created through the program Nizi Project season 2?

entry.title: Sebastiaan de Ranitz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Nazi collaborator Sebastiaan de Ranitz abandoned his office following Mad Tuesday, leaving his department in turmoil?

entry.title: Gedling Town F.C. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gedling Town F.C.'s nickname "The Ferrymen" was inspired by the name of a pub located next to the team's stadium?

entry.title: Antonio Dini (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Antonio Dini was the only survivor of a three-man crew after he crashed a plane into the sea, but had no recollection of the crash due to concussion?

entry.title: pigeon sculpture in Wellington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after a pigeon sculpture in Wellington went missing, members of the public created a memorial for it?
